member.name: M:iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.IbaHDChannelReader.SkipIncrementalRead(System.Int32)
member.summary:
While doing an incremental read of a channel, skip a number of samples.
Incremental reading is not supported for HD-servers prior to version 1.5.4. For an HD-server prior to 1.5.4 the method will report that there is no data, i.e. will be zero after the first call to the method.
member.exception: Thrown if the connection to the HD-server has been lost.

member.name: M:iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.IbaFileChannelReader.QueryNEData(System.Double[]@,System.Object@)
member.param: On return, the timestamps in seconds of the sample values, relative to the start of the file. If is .LENGTH rather than .TIME, distances in length-units are returned instead of seconds.
On return, an array containing the ordinate values as an . The will be an array of values, see remarks for the returned data type of the values.
member.exception: Thrown if the file the channel belongs to has been closed.
Thrown if this is not a non-equidistant channel nor a text channel.
member.remarks:
The that returns will be an array of DataType, where DataType is determined by the following table:
returns :Raw mode data reading () is set on the parent instanceRaw mode data reading is not set on the parent instance
NE_Digital
NE_Real
NE_Double
NE_Int16
NE_Int32
Text
For channels who have data for multiple domains, the default domain is used (Use to determine the default domain).

member.name: M:iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.IbaFileChannelReader.QueryNEData(System.Double[]@,System.String[]@)
member.param: On return, the timestamps in seconds of the sample values, relative to the start of the file. If is .LENGTH rather than .TIME, distances in length-units are returned instead of seconds.
member.exception: Thrown if the file the channel belongs to has been closed.
Thrown if this is not a text channel.
member.remarks: For channels who have data for multiple domains, the default domain is used (Use to determine the default domain).

member.name: M:iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.IbaFileChannelReader.QueryNEData(System.Double[]@,System.Int32[]@)
member.param: On return, the timestamps in seconds of the sample values, relative to the start of the file. If is .LENGTH rather than .TIME, distances in length-units are returned instead of seconds.
member.exception: Thrown if the file the channel belongs to has been closed.
Thrown if this is not a non-equidistant channel or if the ordinate values cannot be represented by an array of values. See remarks.
member.remarks:
For this method to succeed the data samples present in the signal need to be non-equidistantly sampled; i.e. should return true. Additionally the samples in the channel should be stored as 32 bit integer values, should return .NE_Int32. Additionally raw mode data reading should have been enabled on the parent instance of , i.e. should have been set to true.
For channels who have data for multiple domains, the default domain is used (Use to determine the default domain).

member.name: M:iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.IbaFileChannelReader.QueryNEData(System.Double[]@,System.Int16[]@)
member.param: On return, the timestamps in seconds of the sample values, relative to the start of the file. If is .LENGTH rather than .TIME, distances in length-units are returned instead of seconds.
member.exception: Thrown if the file the channel belongs to has been closed.
Thrown if this is not a non-equidistant channel or if the ordinate values cannot be represented by an array of values. See remarks.
member.remarks:
For this method to succeed the data samples present in the signal need to be non-equidistantly sampled; i.e. should return true. Additionally the samples in the channel should be stored as 16 bit integer values, should return .NE_Int16. Additionally raw mode data reading should have been enabled on the parent instance of , i.e. should have been set to true.
For channels who have data for multiple domains, the default domain is used (Use to determine the default domain).

member.name: M:iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.IbaFileChannelReader.QueryNEData(System.Double[]@,System.Boolean[]@)
member.param: On return, the timestamps in seconds of the sample values, relative to the start of the file. If is .LENGTH rather than .TIME, distances in length-units are returned instead of seconds.
member.exception: Thrown if the file the channel belongs to has been closed.
Thrown if this is not a non-equidistant channel or if the ordinate values cannot be represented by an array of values. See remarks.
member.remarks:
For this method to succeed the data samples present in the signal need to be non-equidistantly sampled; i.e. should return true. Additionally the channel should be a digital signal, should return .NE_Digital. Additionally raw mode data reading should have been enabled on the parent instance of , i.e. should have been set to true.
For channels who have data for multiple domains, the default domain is used (Use to determine the default domain).

member.summary: Use this method to inform the instance that no further incremental reads will happen, so the instance can release the resources necessary for the incremental read.

member.name: M:iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.IbaChannelReader.SkipIncrementalRead(System.Int32)
member.summary: While doing an incremental read of a channel, skip a number of samples.
member.param: The desired number of samples to skip.
member.returns: The number of samples actually skipped. This could be less than the requested number of samples if the end of the data is reached.
member.exception: Thrown if has not been called for this channel or if has been called in the mean time.
Thrown if is negative.

member.name: M:iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.IbaHDReader.QueryChannelByName(System.String)
member.exception: Thrown if the connection to the HD-server was not established or has been lost.
member.remarks:
If the query range or requested sampling interval is large, or if the raw level data has been purged, the HD-server might return aggregated data rather than the raw level data. The aggregated data is either the average, maximum or minimum of a segment of lower level data. One can add a suffix to the channel name to specify which aggregated data is desired:
if no suffix is added, the average of the lower level segment is returned.
add "_max" as suffix to the channel name to have the maximum value of the lower level segment.
add "_min" as suffix to the channel name to have the minumum value of the lower level segment.

member.name: M:iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.IbaHDReader.QueryChannelByID(iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.ChannelID)
member.exception: Thrown if the connection to the HD-server was not established or has been lost.
member.remarks:
If the query range or requested sampling interval is large, or if the raw level data has been purged, the HD-server might return aggregated data rather than the raw level data. The aggregated data is either the average, maximum or minimum of a segment of lower level data. One can use the property of to specify which aggregated data is desired:
if left empty, the average of the lower level segment is returned.
specify "max" to have the maximum value of the lower level segment.
specify "min" to have the minumum value of the lower level segment.

member.name: P:iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.ChannelID.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the "tag" of the channel identified by this A channel with a nonempty tag is a sub-channel of a similar channel without a tag.

member.name: P:iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.ChannelID.Valid
member.summary: This property is true if the instance is a valid channel id; otherwise, it is false.
member.remarks:
Validity of a channel id isn't checked during the construction of the id or while setting properties. It is postponed until the id is used in an ibaFiles method, upon which that method will throw an exception. You can check the validity of an id prior to using it in a method with this property.
Because a channel id is internally in ibaFiles encoded as a 32-bit integer, the validity of is determined by the sizes of , and .
For a channel not belonging to a submodule the limits are:
0 value < 2130 value < 216
213 value < 2230 value < 25
For a channel belonging to a submodule the limits are:
0 value < 2130 value < 260 value < 29
0 value < 21326 value < 2110 value < 24

member.name: P:iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.ChannelID.ExpressionNumber

member.name: P:iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.ChannelID.IsExpression

member.name: P:iba.ibaFilesLiteDotNet.ChannelID.IsSubChannel
